post: Katie Schneringers reflection from NCSS is the kind of teacher voice that sticks with you. As the 2025 Gary Colletti Scholarship recipient, Katie writes about something many educators rarely get mid-year: a genuine sense of renewal. From learning alongside social studies teachers nationwide, to quietly walking Washington, D. C. with no agenda beyond curiosity,  her piece captures what happens when teachers are supported, trusted, and given space to remember why this work matters. If you teach history or civics, this is worth a few minutes of your time:  https://bit.ly/4kIH2vN  #SocialStudies  #CivicEducation  #TeacherDevelopment  #ProfessionalLearning

Black History Month is a good moment to put primary sources in students hands. Mississippis 1861 Declaration of Secession states its cause plainly: slavery.
